column5: TJ will you adopt me???  Those trips are the best!!  I hate to repeat what everyone else is saying.. but it's true!!!!
Nice job,  MTBF

Well after the Lakair G2G, and a few days of work, it was time to take back off to camp for a few nites over the July long weekend.  Camp is finally pretty much set up and except for some cleanup and organizing there's finally no work to do, except the mandatory wood cutting and trail cleaning.  Things were pretty uneventful, a little rainy, and the skeeters were bad only on the first nite, so all in all it was a very relaxing trip with lots of decent fish being caught by everyone.. really I caught a few too??  We did Stop at the MacEwans Gas Station in Latchford and picked up some cheap Lucky Strike spoons which we drug around and did very well on.  Fluorescent Orange works well on the Montreal River, as well as Brass/Red.  The spoons were under $2 each so we picked up the whole card full!!  The guy at that station really helped me out of a trailer bearing bind, so I try to stop in and gas up every chance I get!  The wildlife was out in full form.. didn't get any pictures though, but, this trip we saw 4 different species of ducks, a lynx walking along the shoreline 50 feet from the boat... that was AMAZING, 1 moose and 5 bears, two of them were very small cubs with their mothers..  very very cute!!! (for now)  Here's some pictures and a couple of videos form the trip!      This guy visited with us all week.. hes a bit fatter now than he was...     My serious side    The magic spoon!!    We caught lotsa these..  nice fishery there, fish of all year classes around!     Jaden and Muskie sharing the boat!    NOW FOR THE FISH PICTURES!!              Moniques got this funky cross armed pike vulcan hold she can seem to shake???    Avery Cleaned up with some nice topwater bass!              And of course I always get the biggest one!!!     Anyone know what kind of ducks these are??  they hung around the dock and were quite cute...  they aren't blacks...    Tons of wild flowers on the shoreline as well.       Having a woodsplitter there takes alot of the work outta cordwood!! Runs really well!!    We did have one nice fish fry....  done up with fresh garlic and butter!!  Thanks Mr. Pikie!!    My happy place   We played "Sorry" every night.. Avery won most of the time..  I think hes sneaky.. that's what I think!!    Ahh... the sunsets!!        My motto is... "Happy Wife... Happy Life!!"    Lasagna done on the BBQ!!    Now I cant wait to go back,  Off to Lingham Lake this weekend for a trip with some friends, then back to work for a while then hopefully another extra long weekend very soon!!
Somebody has a pretty good life

I see the fish hold is being done very well by all,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,but by,,,,,,,,,,,,,  SQUISH THE FISH HOLD. LOL WHAT THE HELL YOU GOT CLINGING TO YER BONNETT??????????????? Need a big ole fly swatter for that thing.        No lobster tails??????????????  Great report boss. , , , , , , ,,   Wait,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,   ??????
Nice pics TJ.....You guys got it good up there !!!

Excellent report as usual TJ. I kinda feel at home at Camp Jiggy Jiggy already!  BTW, that hold of Monique's  is the famous "Cross Your Heart" hold.  Thanks for showing us the pics and telling the story. Also a tip of the ol' OFC hat for not giving away the GPS coordinates.
Awesome report as usual TJ!  Thanks for sharing...  Maureen
Umm holding the small ones are the problem.. it was a small one that put the hook through my finger.. now Im scared of them!!
Great report ...great motto....great big smiles ....fishing is the catalyst to everything "right"...good on ya...  GPS co-ordinates not required cuz there is water and trees all over the Province
I think you're supposed to hold them by the eyes...  Great report.
Good times TJ! Thanks for the report.  The thing on the bonnet is a camera Brian, I think.  Makes little fish look BIG!
This from a man from da nord.  Still a great report. TFS.
Must be NICE.  Following up one fishing trip with another.  Lookin' great TJ.   (Lucky Bum)
that is really nice vacation..family and fishing always goes togheter
Another Awesome Jiggy Jiggy report.  You guys are so lucky.  I think those are wood ducks, but I'm not positive.  Joey
Almost feels like I'm there. Another great Jiggy Jiggy Report
Great report! and thanks for the pictures.  Thats the summer life I want to live on my weekends.

looks nice as always, glad your getting to spend some time up their in heaven,  we are heading that way on the 28th, going to tent camp the whole trip this year, for a rugged mans tour, if your in the area you guys should come on back, we are going to be going back the old rough road and stay on the island with the sand beach i think.  cant wait to get there.  jason
awesome trip congrats
what a great way to spend the long weekend!  Nothing better then time on the water with family!  Cheers!
Great shots, nice trip.  That's what it's all about.  Hard to tell sometimes with young ducks that don't have adult plumage yet but I'm guessing a brood of young redheads.
Looks like a grand to me was had by all TJ.  The game Sorry is very popular around our house also, Sydney and Amanda win most often though.
Awesome trip TJ. Will you adopt me?  Those ducks are goldeneyes BTW  S.
Always enjoy the family trip reports from Jiggy Jiggy. Awesome once again..
The ducks are young Goldeneyes, they usually nest in hollow tree cavities like old woodpecker holes
Well done TJ, another great trip!
